001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
006import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.internal.NumberStringSerializer;
007
008import java.util.LinkedList;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
011
012import static org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcMessage.Version.*;
013
014/**
015 * JSON-RPC Request POJO
016 */
017public class JsonRpcRequest {
018    private static final JsonRpcMessage.Version DEFAULT_JSON_RPC_VERSION = V2;
019    private static final AtomicLong nextRequestId =  new AtomicLong(0);
020
021    private final String  method;
022    private final List<Object> params;
023    private final String  jsonrpc;   // version
024    private final String  id;
025
026    /**
027     * Constructor for use by Jackson deserialization. Deserialization will typically
028     * be used on the server-side. To create a request on the client side, it
029     * is generally recommended to use the methods in {@link JsonRpcClient}.
030     *
031     * @param jsonrpc filled from the JSON object
032     * @param id filled from the JSON object
033     * @param method filled from the JSON object
034     * @param params filled from the JSON object
035     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, List)
036     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, Object...)
037     */
038    @JsonCreator
039    public JsonRpcRequest(@JsonProperty("jsonrpc")  String jsonrpc,
040                          @JsonProperty("id")       String id,
041                          @JsonProperty("method")   String method,
042                          @JsonProperty("params")   List<Object> params) {
043        this.jsonrpc = jsonrpc;
044        this.method = method;
045        this.id = id;
046        this.params = params;
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * This constructor is slightly more strict than the deserialization constructor and should be used
051     * where possible. It uses the {@link JsonRpcMessage.Version} {@code enum} and requires that
052     * the {@code id} be a {@code long}.
053     *
054     * @param jsonRpcVersion JSON-RPC version (enum)
055     * @param id message id
056     * @param method RPC {@code method}
057     * @param params RPC method positional parameters
058     */
059    public JsonRpcRequest(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion,
060                          long id,
061                          String method,
062                          List<Object> params) {
063        this.jsonrpc    = jsonRpcVersion.jsonrpc();
064        this.method     = method;
065        this.id         = Long.toString(id);
066        this.params     = params;
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Create a JSON RPC request (for serialization.)
071     * Can be used to override default JSON RPC version. To create a request on the client side, it
072     * is generally recommended to use the methods in the {@link JsonRpcClient} you are using.
073     *
074     * @param jsonRpcVersion JSON-RPC version (enum)
075     * @param method Method of remote procedure to call
076     * @param params Parameters to serialize
077     */
078    public JsonRpcRequest(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, String method, List<Object> params) {
079        this(jsonRpcVersion, JsonRpcRequest.nextRequestId.incrementAndGet(), method, removeTrailingNulls(params));
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Create a JSON RPC request (for serialization.) To create a request on the client side, it
084     * is generally recommended to use the methods in {@link JsonRpcClient}.
085     *
086     * @param method Method of remote procedure to call
087     * @param params Parameters to serialize
088     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, List)
089     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, Object...)
090     */
091    public JsonRpcRequest(String method, List<Object> params) {
092        this(DEFAULT_JSON_RPC_VERSION, method, params);
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Convenience constructor for requests with empty parameter list
097     * @param method method name string
098     */
099    public JsonRpcRequest(String method) {
100        this(method, List.of());
101    }
102
103    public String getJsonrpc() {
104        return jsonrpc;
105    }
106
107    public String getMethod() {
108        return method;
109    }
110
111    @JsonSerialize(using=NumberStringSerializer.class)
112    public String getId() {
113        return id;
114    }
115
116    public List<Object> getParams() {
117        return params;
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Remove trailing nulls (all nulls *following* the last non-null object)
122     *
123     * This allows convenience methods to use `null` parameters to indicate the
124     * server-determined default should be used. If `null` were actually passed as
125     * JSON, then the server default would be overridden.  `null` can be used before
126     * the last non-null element, but those `null`s will be sent to the server.
127     */
128    private static List<Object> removeTrailingNulls(List<Object> params) {
129        LinkedList<Object> cleaned = new LinkedList<>(params);
130        while ((cleaned.size() > 0) && (cleaned.getLast() == null)) {
131            cleaned.removeLast();
132        }
133        return cleaned;
134    }
135}
